column1:
T
he instant appeal has been lodged to set aside the judgment dated 11.10.2017
of the High Court of Panadura.
The  accused  appellants  (hereinafter  referred  to  as  the  appellants)  had  been
indicted for 140, 146/296 and in the alternative 32/296 of the Penal Code.
Upon conviction the trial judge had found the appellants guilty for charges one
and three which we think is very unusual and contrary to Law.
The  evidence  of  the  prosecution  is  that  the  incident  had  occurred  on  the
Christmas  day  in  2005  in  the  evening  at  a  hopper  boutique  and  as  such  the
place had been suitably illuminated for the purpose of identification.
The evidence is that the two appellants had come in a three wheeler to the hopper
stand and had said to the brother of the deceased that they were going to kill the
